article_title: Best of the Web Today: On 'Asymmetric Stupidity'
article_text:
"How Politics Makes Us Stupid" is a headline well-suited for this column's "Longest Books Ever Written" running gag, and the article over which it appears is in fact lengthy. The author is the young Washington Post veteran Ezra Klein, who runs Vox.com, a new site hitherto best known for featuring Matthew Yglesias as a lad clad in bad plaid.

Klein's article is about what he calls "cutting-edge research" that "shows that the more information partisans get, the deeper their disagreements...
